title: Adobe Campaign ExperienceEvent Template Mixin
description: Campaign ExperienceEvent mixin for use with schemas for Solution data ingestion. Includes the core/standard ExperienceEvent as well as the required Adobe Campaign ExperienceEvent mixins.

advertising.title: Advertising
advertising.description: Information related to advertising activity in ExperienceEvents.

application.title: Application
application.description: This mixin is used to capture application information related to an ExperienceEvent, including the name of the application, app version, installs, launches, crashes, and closures. It could be either the application targeted by the event like the send of a push notification or the application originating the event such as a click, or a login.

channel.title: Experience channel
channel.description: Experience channel related to the ExperienceEvent.

productListItems.title: Product list items
productListItems.description: A list of items representing a product selected by a customer with specific options and pricing that are for that usage context at a specific point of time and may differ from the product record.

commerce.title: Commerce
commerce.description: Commerce specific data related to this event.

directMarketing.title: Direct marketing
directMarketing.description: Events and properties related to direct and outbound marketing such as email, direct mail, texts, and in-app notifications.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Information about the surrounding situation the event observation occurred in, specifically detailing transitory information such as the network or software versions.

device.title: Device
device.description: An identified device, application or device browser instance that is trackable across sessions, normally by cookies.

placeContext.title: Place context
placeContext.description: The transient circumstances related to the observation. Examples include locale specific information such as weather, local time, traffic, day of the week, workday vs. holiday, and working hours.

marketing.title: Marketing
marketing.description: The information related to marketing activities that are active with the touchpoint.

media.title: Media
media.description: Media activity information related to the experience event.

profileStitch.title: Profile stitch
profileStitch.description: Details about the IDs that were joined by profile stitching.

search.title: Search
search.description: The information related to web or mobile search.

segmentMemberships.title: Segment Memberships
segmentMemberships.description: The segments associated with this ExperienceEvent. Deprecated, use `xdm:segmentMembership` instead.

dataSource.title: Data source
dataSource.description: Globally unique identification of a data source.

receivedTimestamp.title: Received time stamp
receivedTimestamp.description: The time at which this interaction was received by a server.

web.title: Web
web.description: The information related to web page and link of the ExperienceEvent.

message.title: A single message sent to a recipient.

profileSnapshot.title: Profile Snapshot
profileSnapshot.description: Profile Snapshot contains the recipient of the message. This property is primarily used to link the message to a Profile using the `IdentityMap` but it can also be used to freeze some properties of the profile at the time the message was sent.

variant.title: Content Variant
variant.description:
A campaign activity can have multiple variants e.g. Multilingual (translated variants for the same content) or A/B testing (different content to test what works better) but a message delivered to a recipient always contains one of them.
> IMPORTANT: In case of multilingual, the mirror page, the recipient can switch from one variant to another (ex: switch of the language).

seedMember.title: Seed Member
seedMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a seed list for this campaign activity. Seed addresses are used to include recipients who do not match the defined target criteria. Seed members could be your marketing team or other stakeholders who are interested in tracking/measuring the quality of the campaign. SeedMembers get the actual message, at the same time with regular recipients, even when the seedMember does not qualify to be a regular recipient.

quarantine.title: Quarantine
quarantine.description: Address moved to quarantine. The quarantine is set to `true` when the message failed to deliver in a way that indicates that no future messages will be deliverable either to this address.

proofMember.title: Proof Member
proofMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of the proof group for this campaign activity. The proof is a special message that lets you test a delivery before sending to the main target. Proof recipients are responsible for approving both the form and content of the message. It is a pre-delivery target.

controlGroupMember.title: Control Group Member
controlGroupMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a control group for this campaign activity. A control group is a population which will not receive the delivery; it is used to track post-delivery behavior and campaign impact by making a comparison between the control group (or hold out group) with the behavior of target population, which has received the delivery.

testMember.title: A/B Test Member
testMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a test group for this campaign activity. This is primarily used for identifying the initial population of an A/B Test. After sending different variants to the testMembers, the winner Variant is decided to be sent to the remaining population based on behavioral changes in testMembers.

size.title: Size (Bytes)
size.description:
Size in bytes of the message.
* For email, the `size` reflects the all MIME envelope of the message, including the encoded attachments if any.
* For SMS, the `size` reflects the number of bytes necessary to deliver the message.
If that number is over 160 the message will be delivered over more than one SMS.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: The reason why the message could/would not be delivered.

outboundIP.title: IP Address
outboundIP.description: Outbound IP address used to deliver the message.

externalID.title: External ID
externalID.description: An ID generated by the parent activity invoking service to check later if the incoming experienceEvent was generated using this ID.

segmentID.title: Segment ID
segmentID.description: A code or ID assigned to the segment population generated by a segmentation workflow. This can identify the population as part of a result set based on a criteria.

delivery.title: The campaign activity originating a message to a recipient.

id.title: Delivery ID
id.description: The campaign activity originating this message.

from.title: From
from.description:
Address used as a from/sender/caller address. Depending on the communication channel, the `address` has a different format.

  * `email`: an email address.
  * `textMessage` or `phone`: a shortcode or phone number.

testEnabled.title: Test Enabled
testEnabled.description: Specify whether campaign activity is of type A/B testing.

messageClass.title: Message Class
messageClass.description: Mode of delivery for the messages sent.

templateName.title: Delivery Template's Internal Name
templateName.description: A human-friendly identifier of the the parent entity (in case of event_based or continuous message Class) of the campaign activity originating this message.

templateID.title: Identifier of the Template
templateID.description:
The delivery template's ID used to initialize this delivery.

The type the template used in Adobe Campaign can be identified using the `messageClass`.

* `messageClass` = `oneTime`: the template is standard delivery template.
* `messageClass` = `continuous`: the template is a recurring delivery.
* `messageClass` = `transactional`: the template is a transactional message template.

deliveryLabel.title: Delivery Label
deliveryLabel.description: A human-friendly name of the campaign activity which is originating this message.

deliveryName.title: Delivery Internal Name
deliveryName.description: A human-friendly identifier of the campaign activity which is originating this message.

marketingCampaign.title: The campaign activity originating a message to a recipient.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: Identifier of the marketing campaign to which activity originating this message belongs to.

campaignName.title: Campaign Internal Name
campaignName.description: A human-friendly identifier of the marketing campaign which is originating this message.

link.title: The campaign activity originating a message to a recipient.

description.title: Tracking URL Description
description.description: A human-friendly description of the link.

occurrence.title: Occurrence
occurrence.description: URL occurrence index in the content (first is 1). When the same URL is available several times in the same content, its is necessary to track which occurrence of the URL has been clicked on.

label.title: URL Label
label.description: The user-friendly label clicking on which the link opens.

category.title: URL Category
category.description: The category of the link. It may be `subscription`, or a user-defined category.

inAppMessageAction.title: In-App Message Action
inAppMessageAction.description: Actions on the In-App message delivered, e.g. action on primary button, secondary button or close button.

inAppMessageButtonText.title: In-App Message Button Text
inAppMessageButtonText.description: The user-friendly text on the button.

orchestration.title: Campaign Orchestration for creating user journey.

eventID.title: Event ID
eventID.description: ID that identifies the event sent by the data source. This is used by Campaign orchestration to identify the event without inspecting its payload to determine which action should be triggered when the event is received. The value is automatically generated in Campaign at event creation time, it is globally unique across organizations.

orchestrationDetails.title: Orchestration Details
orchestrationDetails.description: Set of attributes that are associated with every orchestration.

containerID.title: Container Identifier
containerID.description: The identifier denoting the container with which Campaign ExperienceEvent is associated.

eventSource.title: Event Source
eventSource.description: A human-friendly name of the campaign activity which is originating this message.

offerOpened.title: Offer Opened
offerOpened.description: The offer in the message for an 'offer opened' event.

offersProposed.title: Offer Propositions
offersProposed.description: The offers in the message of a 'email-send' event.

medium.title: Medium
medium.description: The medium is a combination of the source of the event (message, web, ...) and its format if applicable.

mutation.title: Mutated Fields from Previous ExperienceEvent.
mutation.description: Information of the fields that have changed since the previous ExperienceEvent to keep track of the state changes across events. For e.g. if when an email gets sent, an ExperienceEvent with metric `sends` will be sent. This may get bounced and an ExperienceEvent with metric `bounces` will be sent then. It may be important for a downstream application to know that the previous ExperienceEvent with metric `sends` is now to be invalidated. This field will contain the values from the previous ExperienceEvent that have a different value in the current ExperienceEvent.

propositionID.title: Proposition Identifier
propositionID.description: An identity for the proposition entity associated with an "XDM Decision Event". A single decision event can propose multiple options for a set of activities at once, one for each activity involved. It is the expectation that applications reference this "propositionID" in every experience event that was influenced by the set of propositions. A profile's proposition-response history is maintained with these proposition identifiers.

supplementalDataID.title: Supplemental Data Identifier
supplementalDataID.description: Identifier used to stitch Target events with Analytics events

originDatasetID.title: Origin Dataset ID
originDatasetID.description: Identity of the dataset that the Unified Profile Service ingested the data from. Usage is reserved for the Unified Profile Service.

endUserIDs.title: EndUserIDs
endUserIDs.description: Condensed, normalized encapsulation of end user identifiers asserted for this ExperienceEvent.
